husband as sometimes he would assume the baby was just crying and not try to fix it be sure to tell him that he is allowed and encouraged to put the baby down in safe place and step out of the room house when he gets overwhelmed sometime just few minutes of quiet fresh air can help lot be sure to tell him he is allowed to try to do things differently from the way you do them or tell him to do them as long as it safe some things that work for mom wont work for dad and some things that work for dad wont work for mom though feeding the baby without holding him is one of those things that is not allowed because it simply not safe be sure to split things 50 50 when you are both home staying home with baby is work neither one of you have the right unless this was agreed upon before the baby came along to claim they worked harder and so the other parent must do everything else few minuets of down time is acceptible for both you my husband usually gets 30 40 mins of down time when he gets that lifeline things that really really helped all three of us the dvd the happiest baby on the block it gave my husband so many ways of soothing our daughter he would be frustrated because he could soothe her by nursing like could even bottle of pumped milk would have the same effect have given this dvd as baby gifts many many times because it is so helpful and the other thing was swing importantly it had to swing side to side and have plug instead of batteries so it would run out mid soothe this is how showered how ate how took moment to breathe best piece of baby equipment that we blue eyed genes for being one of the very few of their kind to beat out the darker genetics read somewhere that dark always trumps light in the genetic pool so you must be badass my boy is weeks old and looks nothing like me he looks just like my husband but very proud of that fact so ca say that understand where he coming from lot of the nurses at the hospital were baffled by how proud was that my baby looked like my hubby apparently nobody is that way and one parent is always initially butthurt about it personally fell in love with my husband and find him very handsome so to have baby that looks like him makes me quite proud oh goodness ppd is no joke and is terrifying was on the alert for that for the first two months for myself because while do suffer from any psychiatric disorders did suffer from anxiety few years back and my father mother had depression and was totally crazy you just never know think the best thing you can do for yourself and your husband in this situation when he calls you at work is be his cheerleader if he calling you frustrated and you get frustrated in return the situation will escalate it may feel entirely counter intuitive but when he calls you try telling him how great father he is remind him that he does need your help because he is equal part parent and he can do this sometimes the hardest part of parenting for mothers and fathers is the crippling self doubt every time you give in and go home and help him out it reinforces to him that he is the right person for the job so even though that is what he is asking you to do it probably is helping your cause he is the father and fully capable of taking care of your son you know that so try and help him know it too it will help him be more competent and confident which ultimately means he ll stop calling you so much so it good for everyone do mean to oversimplify recognize these situations with spouses and new babies are complex and it will likely take little while to get into good routine just offering one suggestion good luck can your husband take the baby out to play group or something similar sure the kid is too small to play but those groups are just as much about getting parents out of the house as they are about the kids some time to chill with adults even if most of them are women which might be bit awkward for him could help regularly go to playgroup where hang out with dad who is also regular he does identify with most of the moms who go especially the ones who only talk about their babies but we both like motorcycling and have similar tastes in tv shows etc so we have non kid stuff to talk about while our kids do their thing it nice for both of us and sure helps to make sure the walls do close in thoughts can you get sitter maybe if he only had to do it one day week it would be easier for him to handle do get hung up on what you can handle versus what you think he should be able to handle if he ca he ca he ll probably adjust over time but maybe little extra help now would make big difference maybe he just needs bit more confidence can you affirm him more that he good dad let him know he doing great and it okay if things do go perfectly my husband is great with our kids but he just does enjoy being home alone with both of them think part of the reason is he puts lot of pressure on himself to be good dad so he makes things in my opinion lot harder than they need to be giving the kids continual high energy attention instead of just letting them be different issue than yours of course but think it comes out of the pressure he puts on himself to be good dad maybe your husband is feeling the same pressure
